content.description: This follows the west facing crack.  For me the crux was on the beginning.  This is a  great warm-up for Fire Pit.
content.location: This follows the west facing crack just right of the Fire Pit route

climbs.name: North Face of Fire Pit Rock

content.description: A beautiful 20+ foot line up the obvious overhanging face of the large boulder next to the pay station. The route starts on a left hand undercling, right hand on left facing holds, bump up on more pinches to a pinch crimp. Lunge right hand to the top pinch crimp, use the left facing dihedral holds, with your left hand set you feet and pop left hand to the obvious shark tooth edge, right hand to the gaston and then up to the chicken-head horn and then a simple toss to the seam over the lip...short easy slab to follow. V8 from a cheat stone(original version)also bearing in mind that Bob is 6'2" and used a cheat stone, V10 from the obvious left hand undercling and no cheat stone.

pathTokens: Campground and Walk of Nature Loop Boulders

content.description: The illustrious Fire Pit Boulder. Home of one of the best Bob Murray test-piece routes in Arizona and the southwest. The Fire Pit boulder is in close proximity to the pay-station and right within the campground. Premium granite, a few warm-ups and an idyllic setting make this a great place to start or finish the day.
